titles.title: Kelvin-Mach wake in a two-dimensional Fermi sea

abstracts.value: The dispersion law for plasma oscillations in a two-dimensional electron gas in the hydrodynamic approximation interpolates between $\Omega \propto \sqrt{q}$ and $\Omega \propto q$ dependences as the wave vector $q$ increases. As a result, downstream of a charged impurity in the presence of a uniform supersonic electric current flow, a wake pattern of induced charge density and potential is formed whose geometry is controlled by the Mach number $M$. For $1\sqrt{2}$. These wakes also trail an external charge traveling supersonically a fixed distance away from the electron gas.
